entry.title: Can we block position Update if done with the wrong Effective Date ?
entry.content:
we have identified a situation where employees are not correctly replicated because

Position is updated in Position Org Chart just after an employee has been rehired on these specific position.

If the position Effective Date = Rehire Date then Replication is blocked until the Rehire date is effective.

These is preventing 30d prior arrival creation in many third party systems.

After investigating these issue, it seems the only option available is to create an admin alert (Position Follow-Up Admin Alert.)to the employee updating the position (HR)  in order to tell him to correct the effective date of the position change to be greater than rehire date.

These means : 

HR rehire on Position X user A on Jan 20th 

HR updates with effective date Jan 20th the position 

Position updates is replicated in futur-records in job information.

The business rule to trigger the admin alert is only configured at the job information level, when correction have to occure in both :

- position 

- job information

to have a clean employee record.

it's rather complex setup to configure  admin alerts and there is high risk that HR doesn't go to Admin Alert and see the problem.

it would make more sense if we could execute a validation in Position Org Chart to compare position Start Date & incumbent Start Date. if these 2 dates are identical, we could have an error message, which blocks any wrong data to be entered on the system and forces correct date > rehire date to be entered.

but so far

entry.title: Compensation Review and External Users
entry.content:
Hello, i was hoping to get some advice on, if possible, we have a sister company that does not have an org structure or employees in EC. Through an organisational transformation we have some teams that report into the main company, and managers who will perform the remuneration review within the main company i.e. employee in P&C employed by sister company, report into manager in main company. 

Is it possible to upload a flat file for these employees in the sister company to include them in the workbooks for the remuneration review for the manager?

entry.title: With full profile the pay stub is opening in a new tab. Is there a workaround or a custom solution
entry.content:
With full profile the pay stub is opening in a new tab. This creates a security risk on shared retail store devices.

Is there a workaround or a custom solution that we can implement to force the pay stub open in the same tab? Can the redirect link be configured to open in the same tab?

entry.title: Need to assign a time profile to the Global Assignment record in the host country but error
entry.content:
Need to assign a time profile to the Global Assignment record in the host country but following error is displayed:

Business Rule FlexibleAccountStartDate_Sick Leave cannot determine the Flexible Account Start Date for account type ZAF_SICK_TAT. Please take a look at the rule or temporarily remove the time information from the job information.
I looked at the rule and it has not changed since go live in 2019.
The rule worked until November 2025 when suddenly, we cannot amend the Time Profile on Job Information portlet.

entry.title: Administer Time off/ leave amount to all employees in bulk in a dnamic way

entry.title: 'Select All' fields option in the Story Report
entry.content:
Currently, when generating a story report, there is no option to select all fields, neither at the Query Designer, nor at the Add Dimensions section for either the Rows or Columns areas. Each field added from the data source must be selected individually (manually) in the Add Dimensions section for it to appear in the report.

There should be a ‘Select All’ fields option available at the top of the field selection list within the Query Designer and at Add Dimensions section. This would allow users to select all fields at once when needed, while still preserving the option to manually select/deselect individual fields.

Implementing this functionality would greatly benefit users who create, modify, or enhance Story reports, ultimately improving overall user experience. If you feel the same, I would request you to vote for the customer influence idea:

https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/idea/357089 

#SuccessFactors #StoryReports #Analytics SAP SuccessFactors Platform @Anvesh_Sankoori

entry.title: Employee Central Global Benefits - Wallet Functionality
entry.content:
We are looking the EC Global Benefits module for a client and want to investigate the Wallet functionality in more detail.

The client has a requirement to have a Flex Credit/Bank setup for employees to purchase additional coverages for insurance and pension. This credit is calculated as a percentage of their annual salary and an additional requirement is to have remaining balances moved to the employees health spending account at the end of open enrolment.

We are trying to understand if the Wallet functionality can support this type of requirement in the Global Benefits module and to see if there's additional material on how to implement the wallet functionality.

entry.title: Configuring Multi-Time-Zone Support in SAP SuccessFactors (Single Time Zone Currently Set)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I was wondering how to configure the time zone settings for an SAP SuccessFactors instance that is currently set to a single time zone, and add support for multiple time zones.

As far as I understand, there’s no additional setup required—each user can simply select their time zone in Job Information. Is that correct? If there are any additional settings I need to configure, could you please let me know?

- The tenant preferred time zone is set to Asia/Tokyo, and we plan to add additional countries such as the United States, China, the United Kingdom, France, and Mexico.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Leave Accrual Customization Based on Year to Year
entry.content:
Dear Community Member,

I hope this message finds you well.

I would like to bring to your attention a critical requirement from my client regarding leave accrual customization on year to year

Here is the requirement

We have a leave type called “Anniversary Leave” where the accrual will happen on the anniversary date which is happening but however client want when employee completes 5 years/10 years/15 years the leave accrual should happened on Anniversary Date but for rest year i.e on 6th Year/7th Year/8th Year/9th Year leave should accrued on 1st Jan of that particular year not on anniversary date.

 Example: For an employee with a DOJ of 16/04/2020, 1 extra leave day will be added on 16/04/2025(On Completion of 5 years), which is working correctly as per current configuration but twist is here

From the following year onward, Anniversary Leave will be accrued on January 1st of each year instead of the anniversary day.

For example:

  • In 2026, 2027, 2028 & 2029, leave will be added on 01/01/2026, 01/01/2027, 01/01/2028 & 01/01/2029 respectively
  • For the 10-year milestone, the employee will again receive the Anniversary Leave on their actual anniversary date (not on January 1st).

Example: On 16/04/2030, 2 extra anniversaries leave days will be added.

  • After the 10-year milestone, the same rule applies: for the consecutive years following the 10-year anniversary, leave will be accrued on January 1st of each year (e.g., 2031, 2032, 2033 & 2034).

Can we achieve this?

Thanks!

entry.title: How Does HRIS Sync Handle Time Zones and Effective Dates for Global Users?
entry.content:
Hello Experts, 

We have only used Employee Central (EC) for users in the KST time zone so far.
However, we will soon be adding users in other time zones (e.g., the U.S., France, Mexico, and Australia).

As we introduce users in different time zones, we have a question regarding HRIS Sync. The HRIS Sync job is currently scheduled to run at 00:00 KST.

If the job runs based on KST (as shown in the table), we expect that for some countries the effective date may be treated as the previous day (i.e., processed one day earlier). We are concerned this could cause issues for processes such as hiring and termination. In particular, we suspect that terminations for users outside KST could be processed a day earlier and set users to Inactive prematurely.

We would appreciate your feedback on whether this assumption is correct.
If we are misunderstanding how HRIS Sync handles time zones and effective dates, please let us know.

KST2026-01-0100:00
UTC2025-12-3115:00
Paris2025-12-3116:00
London2025-12-3115:00
Mexico City2025-12-3109:00
AEST2026-01-0101:00


Thanks advance.

entry.title: SuccessFactors Custom Portlet Notifications via CPI to Microsoft Teams
entry.content:
Detailed Problem Description / Question

I’m looking for guidance (or an SAP KBA reference) around sending notifications from SAP SuccessFactors to Microsoft Teams via SAP CPI, specifically when the source is a custom portlet.

In our scenario, we have a custom portlet in SuccessFactors that displays an alert or status message on the SuccessFactors home page. Unlike standard SuccessFactors Teams notifications, this custom portlet does not automatically trigger a Teams notification.

The requirement is as follows:

  • A notification or alert occurs in a custom SuccessFactors portlet

  • This event should be picked up by SAP CPI

  • CPI should then send a notification to a Microsoft Teams channel (webhook)

At this stage, we understand that:

  • SuccessFactors does not natively generate MS Teams notifications for custom portlets

  • Any notification would likely require custom integration logic (e.g. OData, Integration Center extract, or custom API trigger)

  • CPI would be responsible for transforming the message and forwarding it to Microsoft Teams

My questions are:

  1. Is there an official SAP KBA or documentation that confirms custom portlets do not support native notifications?

  2. Are there recommended or supported approaches for enabling CPI to detect an event or change from a custom portlet?

  3. Has anyone successfully implemented a CPI → Microsoft Teams notification for a custom SuccessFactors object or portlet, and if so, what approach was used?

Best Regards

Adele Beets
